meanings.definition: a downward spiral or decrease in value or quality
meanings.sent1: The company experienced a series of downspins in their sales this quarter.
meanings.sent2: The downspins in the stock market caused many investors to panic.
meanings.sent3: The downspins in the quality of the product left customers disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her mood took a sudden downspins after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The downspins in the economy were felt by everyone in the community.

meanings.definition: to decrease rapidly or sharply in value or quality
meanings.sent1: The demand for the product downspins when the price increases.
meanings.sent2: If the company doesn't improve its services, it will downspins quickly.
meanings.sent3: The team's performance downspins whenever they don't practice enough.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement downspins when she realizes she forgot her wallet at home.
meanings.sent5: The value of the antique vase downspins dramatically after it gets a crack.

meanings.definition: the act of spinning or rotating downward
meanings.sent1: The gymnast's downspins during her routine were flawless.
meanings.sent2: The tornado's downspins caused destruction in the town.
meanings.sent3: The toy top's downspins fascinated the children watching.
meanings.sent4: The helicopter's downspins made everyone on board feel dizzy.
meanings.sent5: The ice skater's graceful downspins wowed the audience.
